subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Sunday, 13 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Sheff Utd 1-2 Wigan
Wigan win at Sheff Utd to secure Premiership survival and relegate their hosts.



 
Man Utd 0-1 West Ham
Carlos Tevez fires West Ham to a shock win at Man Utd to keep his side in the Premiership.



 
Tottenham 2-1 Man City
Tottenham secure fifth spot with a narrow win over a determined City side at White Hart Lane.








GOLF




Westwood ends wait for tour title
Lee Westwood takes the Andalucia Open to win his first European tour title since 2003.



 
Andalucia Open leaderboard
Latest updates from the European Tour event in Marbella.



 
O'Hair leads as Donald finds form
Sean O'Hair leads The Players' Championship after three rounds but Luke Donald moves into contention after a 65.








MOTORSPORT




Hamilton takes lead in title race
McLaren's Lewis Hamilton leads the world championship after finishing second to Ferrari's Felipe Massa in the Spanish Grand Prix.



 
Haga rides to double win at Monza
Nori Haga earns a win double at Monza but James Toseland increases his championship lead.



 
Lapwatch: Spanish Grand Prix
The McLaren and Ferrari drivers rejoin their intense world title battle at Barcelona's Circuit de Catalunya.








FORMULA ONE




Hamilton takes lead in title race
McLaren's Lewis Hamilton leads the world championship after finishing second to Ferrari's Felipe Massa in the Spanish Grand Prix.



 
Lapwatch: Spanish Grand Prix
The McLaren and Ferrari drivers rejoin their intense world title battle at Barcelona's Circuit de Catalunya.



 
Massa snatches pole from Alonso
Ferrari's Felipe Massa takes pole from Fernando Alonso in the dying seconds of qualifying for Sunday's Spanish Grand Prix.








ATHLETICS




Cheruiyot victory in Glasgow 10K
Vivian Cheruiyot wins the women's 10 kilometres road race in Glasgow.



 
Legendary running track reopens
A £19m sports complex is opened at the historic site where Roger Bannister broke the four-minute mile.



 
Glasgow begins Commonwealth bid
Glasgow's official 2014 bid document  is on its way to London to be handed over to the Games Federation.








CYCLING




Hoy fails with second record bid
Chris Hoy misses out on the kilometre world record in Bolivia by just five thousandths of a second.



 
McEwen pips Bettini to stage win
Robbie McEwan out-sprints Paolo Bettini to claim the second stage of the Giro d'Italia.



 
Liquigas snatch Giro time-trial
The Italian Liquigas team win the opening team time-trial stage of the Giro d'Italia and Enrico Gasparotto takes the pink jersey.








FUN AND GAMES




Review of the week
Freddy Shepherd offers to "carry Michael Owen to Liverpool"



 
Holloway column
"Maybe Blair could be the next manager of Newcastle, if he can take the pressure"



 
Ten to tackle
Test your sporting knowledge of the last seven days
